intro: Ruellia auriculata, commonly known as the ear-shaped ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are square and somewhat woody. Ruellia auriculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
